author: tuyen4818
content:
I found an issue in lodestar's  sha256`digest()` function
I notice the only client that sometimes has the same `message-id` to lodestar is grandine so maybe an issue there, if you want to double there cc <@498331483732312075> 
(but sometimes the same grandine node returned the same `message-id` to other clients so it's confusing ..)

author: stealth.gecko
content:
Hi. I'm trying to setup a beacon rpc with lodestar. Here's my command ```bash
sudo docker run -d --network=host --restart=no \
    -v "/home/muhitrhn/jwt.hex:/jwt.hex" \
    -v "/home/muhitrhn/.lodestar:/data" \
    "chainsafe/lodestar:latest" \
    beacon \
    --network=sepolia \
    --dataDir=/data \
    --jwtSecret=/jwt.hex \
    --listenAddress=0.0.0.0 \
    --port=9000 \
    --discoveryPort=9000 \
    --checkpointSyncUrl=https://lodestar-sepolia.chainsafe.io \
    --enr.ip="34.71.222.126" \
    --enr.tcp=9000 \
    --rest \
    --rest.address=0.0.0.0 \
    --rest.port=4000 \
    --rest.namespace="*" \
    --execution.urls=https://ethereum-sepolia-rpc.publicnode.com \
    --targetPeers=160 \
    --discv5=true \
    --logLevel=debug \
    --logFile=/data/lodestar.log \
    --logFileLevel=debug```
I'm getting errors in the attachment. Any help please?

author: __flcl
content: Hm in case of a small network, there is 1 hop. But what if we make a circle from nodes so they see just two neighbors? Can help to test more real case in a small network ig
